headline: AI boom will continue despite bubble fears: Arm CMO
summary: Arm (ARM) Holdings, the semiconductor design company that lists Microsoft (MSFT), Nvidia (NVDA), Meta (META) and Apple (AAPL) among its many partners, expects surging revenue driven by AI - even as fears of a bubble keep growing. Chief Marketing Officer Ami Badani spoke with Ramzan Karmali about the firm's strategy to expand across data centers and mobile devices, while continuing to push for more energy-efficient chips. For more live coverage of the markets, watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and visit Yahoo Finance.

headline: Is Tesla Still a Good Value After This Year’s 20.7% Rally?
summary: Wondering if Tesla is actually worth the hype or if the current price still offers upside? Let’s break down what matters for value-focused investors. Shares have seen a rollercoaster lately, dropping 8.2% in the last week and 6.9% over the past month. However, they are still up 7.8% year-to-date and a solid 20.7% over the past 12 months. Tesla’s price movements have been influenced by high-profile updates, such as announcements around new model launches, evolving leadership strategies, and...

headline: Elon Musk Said He Works 'Every Waking Hour.' If You Work 100 Hours A Week While Others Work 50, You'll Get Twice As Much Done
summary: Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) CEO Elon Musk has always been known for his extreme work ethic. Over the years, he’s repeatedly said that long hours and intense dedication are central to his success. His approach is simple: The more time you put in, the more you get out. Working Nonstop, Sleeping On The Floor “You need to work super hard,” Musk told graduates during a 2014 commencement speech at the University of Southern California’s Marshall School of Business. headline: 'You Don't Drive A $27,000 Car With A $60,000 Income,' Says Dave Ramsey, Urging 27-Year-Old Dad With $100,000 Debt To Sell The Car
summary: A 27-year-old Texas man called into "The Ramsey Show" to ask how he and his wife, who earns $60,000 a year, could handle about $100,000 in debt — including a $27,000 car loan — while he stays home with two young children. Personal finance host Dave Ramsey immediately zeroed in: "You don't drive a $27,000 car with a $60,000 income." He told the caller, whose name was Jesse, that this was a clear sign the couple needed to sell the car and reset their financial priorities. Don't Miss: Missed Nvidia
